com.welie.blessed

Class BluetoothPeripheralManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.welie.blessed.BluetoothPeripheralManager

  • public class BluetoothPeripheralManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent a peripheral running on the local phone

        Create a BluetoothPeripheralManager
        Parameters:
        context - the application context
        bluetoothManager - a valid BluetoothManager
        callback - an instance of BluetoothPeripheralManagerCallback where the callbacks will be handled

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the BluetoothPeripheralManager Application should call this method as early as possible after it is done with this BluetoothPeripheralManager.

      • startAdvertising

        public void startAdvertising(@NotNull
                             @NotNull AdvertiseSettings settings,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull AdvertiseData advertiseData,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull AdvertiseData scanResponse)
        Start Bluetooth LE Advertising. The advertiseData will be broadcasted if the operation succeeds. The scanResponse is returned when a scanning device sends an active scan request. This method returns immediately, the operation status is delivered through BluetoothPeripheralManagerCallback.onAdvertisingStarted(AdvertiseSettings) or BluetoothPeripheralManagerCallback.onAdvertiseFailure(AdvertiseError).
        Parameters:
        settings - the AdvertiseSettings
        advertiseData - the AdvertiseData
        scanResponse - the ScanResponse

      • stopAdvertising

        public void stopAdvertising()
        Stop advertising

      • add

        public boolean add(@NotNull
                   @NotNull BluetoothGattService service)
        Add a service to the peripheral

        Once a service has been added to the list, the service and its included characteristics will be provided by the local peripheral.

        If the local peripheral has already exposed services when this function is called, a service update notification will be sent to all clients. A callback on BluetoothPeripheralManagerCallback.onServiceAdded(com.welie.blessed.GattStatus, BluetoothGattService) will be received when this operation has completed

        Parameters:
        service - the service to add
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false otherwise

      • remove

        public boolean remove(@NotNull
                      @NotNull BluetoothGattService service)
        Remove a service
        Parameters:
        service - the service to remove
        Returns:
        true if the service was removed, otherwise false

      • getServices

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.util.List<BluetoothGattService> getServices()
        Get a list of the all advertised services of this peripheral
        Returns:
        a list of zero or more services

      • notifyCharacteristicChanged

        public boolean notifyCharacteristicChanged(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull byte[] value,
                                           @NotNull
                                           @NotNull BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        Send a notification or indication that a local characteristic has been updated

        A notification or indication is sent to all remote centrals to signal that the characteristic has been updated.

        Parameters:
        characteristic - the characteristic for which to send a notification
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, otherwise false

        Parameters:
